hotspots.hotspot:
Solid

The particles in a solid are closer together than in a liquid or a gas. The particles are also organized. For that reason, a solid has a definite shape and volume.

Liquid

Although the particles in a liquid are still fairly close together, they are farther apart than in a solid. They are also disorganized. Liquids have a definite volume but can change shape.

Gas

The particles that make up a gas are far apart and disorganized. Gases do not have a definite shape or a definite volume.

content.instruction: Extensive property - a property that depends on the amount of substance present

hotspots.hotspot:
Mass

The mass depends on how much of the substance is present.

Volume:

The volume depends on how much space the substance occupies.

Length:

The length depends on how long the object is.

Weight:

The weight depends on how much mass is present.

scene.credits: (tr)Lauren Burke/Photographer's Choice RF/Getty Images, (c)Stockbyte/Getty Images, (bkgd)Image Source/Getty Images.

answers.answer: cannot be used to identify the substance.
do not change the composition of the substance.
can only occur at room temperature.
can be observed only with the use of special instruments.

multiple.question: Which of the following is an example of an intensive physical property?
Which of the following is NOT an example of a physical change or property?

answers.answer: A sheet of copper is hammered until it is only 1.0 mm thin.
A piece of paper is burned and leaves a pile of ashes.
A piece of limestone is crushed by striking it with a hammer.
A jar of solid iodine is opened and a purple gas is emitted from the jar.
A metal wire gets hot as it conducts electricity.

multiple.question: Which of the following best describes boiling?

answers.answer: The amount of space an object takes up
The measure of how much matter is in an object
D. The ratio of the mass of a substance to its volume
